abstracts.cdata!:
This Report Profile tells us about
            strengthening public finances, the social safety net, and
            competitiveness in Georgia. In 2008–09, Georgia was hit with
            the dual shocks of the August 2008 conflict with Russia and
            the global financial crisis. The authorities were faced with
            the dual challenges of mitigating the impact of the economic
            downturn in the short term, and facilitating recovery and
            preparing Georgia for post-crisis growth in the medium term.
            The Development Policy Operations (DPO) series was formed by
            World Bank which supported a macroeconomic and fiscal
            framework to restore confidence and mitigate the downturn in
            2009, followed by quality fiscal adjustment to safeguard
            sustainability as economic recovery took hold in 2010–11.
            The social safety net was strengthened to support poor and
            vulnerable segments of the population during difficult
            economic times. The DPO -supported reforms provided
            financial and medical aid to thousands of poor and
            vulnerable Georgians while the economy regained its footing.
            Around 440,000 people received targeted social assistance in
            2011 and roughly 900,000 people received targeted medical
            insurance. The reforms have also bolstered investor
            confidence and improved competitiveness by reducing business
            costs and making it faster and easier to move goods in and
            out of Georgia.
